text: The 1988 NCAA Division I Men's Swimming and Diving Championships were contested in March 1988 at the Indiana University Natatorium in Indianapolis, Indiana at the 65th annual NCAA-sanctioned swim meet to determine the team and individual national champions of Division I men's collegiate swimming and diving in the United States. The men's and women's titles would not be held at the same site until 2006. Texas topped the team standings, 54.5 points ahead of three-time defending champions Stanford. It was the Longhorns' second title and the second for coach Eddie Reese. ==Team standings== *Note: Top 10 only *(H) = Hosts *(DC) = Defending champions *Full results {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !! title: 1988 NCAA Division I Men's Swimming and Diving Championships
